Separately sequenced barcode?: This can be done using gDNA if scRNAseq is not being done (but not in the datasets we use)
Separately amplified barcode?: Yes, primers are used to identify barcode region and cell ID region to amplify separately
Filtering metrics - cells/ RNAseq/ATAC-s: Cells with less than 200 genes, cell-type dependent cutoff for mitochondrial gene content
Filtering metrics - barcode reads, barco: searching for sequences complementary to the side reaction library preparation primers, filtering out reads that lack the GFP barcode sequence, have too many repeated nucleotides, or do not meet a phred score cut-off
Are reads with identical cellID and UMI: Yes and the minimum number of reads is used as a cutoff
Are similar barcodes merged? How?: Starcode based on Levenshtein distance (cutoff based on manual inspection)
Doublet detection method used?: stringent gene count cutoff per cell, any cell having more than 1 barcode is removed

Separately amplified barcode?: Yes, it was amplified in the cDNA and the amplicon library was sequenced
Filtering metrics - barcode reads, barco:
reads:
it aligns to the region that is supposed to be the barcode(clone ID)
has both cellID and UMI
Are reads with identical cellID and UMI: All the barcodes(clone IDs) associated with the same cell ID and UMI are replaced by the consensus sequence
Are similar barcodes merged? How?: Hamming distance of 5 and all the sequences in a cluster are marked to have the sequuence that is most frequent in that cluster
Doublet detection method used?: Used mutually exclusive genes to detect doublets

Separately amplified barcode?: Yes, the amplified library is split into 2 and one of them is used to separately amplify the barcodes
Filtering metrics - cells/ RNAseq/ATAC-s: Abundant UMIs for reads in cells,<20% mitochondrial genes
Filtering metrics - barcode reads, barco:
minimum of 29 bp of gfp has to be present in the read, the cell ID must be present in the scRNAseq data, 
minimum reads for (cellID-Barcode-UMI) is 10
Are reads with identical cellID and UMI: Yes and there is cutoff for minimum number of reads(10)
Are similar barcodes merged? How?: Hamming distance of 3 - graph connected components based algorithm
Doublet detection method used?: Scrublet- doublet score thresholded based on manual inspection

Separately sequenced barcode?: They can be separately sequenced and the Barcode is identified from the barcode based on the sequences flanking the barcode and then filtered based on some metrics: correct upstream constant region, PHRED score > 30 average, did not contain N residues, had expected barcode pattern - then it was mapped to SPLINTR reference library with 2 mismatches
Separately amplified barcode?: No (it is captured along with scRNAseq)
Filtering metrics - cells/ RNAseq/ATAC-s: Filtered to remove cells with <500 genes, <1000 UMIs, >15% mitichondrial gene content
Filtering metrics - barcode reads, barco: The barcodes are identified based on the sequences flanking it, have correct upstream sequence, had correct pattern, did not have NN sequences, have PHRED quality >30 all over the barcode, mapped to the reference index upto 2 mismatches
Are similar barcodes merged? How?: Starcode was used for creating a list of barcodes in library but not otherwsie
Doublet detection method used?: Yes, based on hashtag oligo combinations with the HTODemux function. Also,  droplets containing a combination of two or more SPLINTR barcodes not observed in any other cell were considered to be doublets and were removed.

total unique barcodes: 5,472,944 unique lineage barcodes detected in the Watermelon library
Separately sequenced barcode?: Yes,the whole transciptome obtained is amplified, targetted lbraries are gel separated and then amplified
Filtering metrics - cells/ RNAseq/ATAC-s: Cells should have between 1000-4200 genes, less than 10% mitichondrial gene content
Filtering metrics - barcode reads, barco: Need to have the necessary barcode pattern, the length should be exactly 30 and the cell IDs containing these barcodes must be seen in 10X data also
Are reads with identical cellID and UMI: Yes, they are collapsed by using only unique entries of CellID-Barcode_UMI sequence
Are similar barcodes merged? How?:
Yes, they have a method:
1) Count number of UMIs supporting each barcode
2) Find the edit distance to the most common barcodes for all lineage barcodes
3)If edit distance is less than 3, add the UMIs of this barcode to the most common barcode and remove this entry
4) If a barcode associated with the cell had UMI count less than 3 times the UMI count of the barcode with max UMI count, this barcode was removed
ATAC data available?: Yes, but not in the original paper

Separately amplified barcode?: The cDNA obtained during 10X sequencing is amplified; after scATAC seq, it is amplified using primers
Filtering metrics - cells/ RNAseq/ATAC-s: Low-quality cells with high mitochondrial reads, low UMIs and features per cell were removed,
Filtering metrics - barcode reads, barco: Cells with 1-25 barcodes are kept. Cell ID- CellTag - UMI supported by just 1 read are removed

Separately sequenced barcode?: Yes, it was done for both pre- and post-treated cells
Separately amplified barcode?: No, it was directly read from the BAM file after CellRanger with no amplification step
Filtering metrics - cells/ RNAseq/ATAC-s: Minimum transcript counts - 4000, percentage content of mitochondrial genes - 8%, minimum number of genes sequenced - 750 (the exact values depends on dataset)
Filtering metrics - barcode reads, barco: The 3' and 5' adapters flanking the barcode are used to identify the region, minimum - 3' adapter + 10 bp barcode sequence. Also, for gDNA sequenced barcodes, singleton barcodes that were not clustered in Starcode were discarded.
Are reads with identical cellID and UMI: For barcode reads less than 20, all barcode reads within the cell were compared. If an exact match was found for the 3' end of a longer barcode, this read was extended. These corrected barcodes were omitted if they were absent in the list of known clones in TP0. The UMI-replicate reads were resolved by using the most frequent barcode read for each cell if none of the other barcodes in the cell had a count greater than 50% of the most frequent barcode. If this was not true, the clonal reads were all removed from the cell
Are similar barcodes merged? How?: Yes for gDNA sequencing of cells, starcode is used implementing a message-passing algorithm with a maximum Levenshtein distance of 1 and minimum radius size of 3.
